identity.Secret: Elliptic Curve Diffie-Hellman Ephemeral (ECDHE) Key Exchange is a cryptographic protocol used to establish a shared secret between two parties over an insecure channel. It's based on the Diffie-Hellman key exchange but uses elliptic curve cryptography instead of modular arithmetic. The Ephemeral part means that a new key pair is generated for each session, providing forward secrecy.
